discover.instruction: Read about a typical morning. Notice the verb + particle combinations.
discover.instruction_ru: Прочитай о типичном утре. Обрати внимание на комбинации глагол + частица.

content.text: Every morning, I <highlight>wake up</highlight> at 7 AM. I <highlight>get up</highlight> slowly and <highlight>turn on</highlight> the coffee machine. While I wait, I <highlight>look through</highlight> my emails. I <highlight>write down</highlight> important tasks for the day. After breakfast, I <highlight>put on</highlight> my clothes and <highlight>go out</highlight>. I sometimes <highlight>run into</highlight> my neighbor. We <highlight>catch up</highlight> on news. If I'm late, I <highlight>hurry up</highlight>. At work, I <highlight>switch on</highlight> my computer and <highlight>get down to</highlight> work. I <highlight>look forward to</highlight> my lunch break!
content.question: What happens to the meaning when we add 'up', 'on', 'out' to verbs?
content.question_ru: Что происходит со значением, когда мы добавляем 'up', 'on', 'out' к глаголам?

points.rule: Phrasal verb = verb + particle (up, down, on, off, in, out, etc.)
points.rule_ru: Фразовый глагол = глагол + частица (up, down, on, off, in, out и т.д.)
points.example: wake up, turn off, get in, take out

points.rule: Meaning often different from original verb
points.rule_ru: Значение часто отличается от исходного глагола
points.example: look = смотреть, look after = заботиться, look up = искать (в словаре)

points.rule: Separable: object can go between verb and particle
points.rule_ru: Разделяемые: дополнение может идти между глаголом и частицей
points.example: Turn off the light = Turn the light off = Turn it off (NOT: Turn off it)

points.rule: Inseparable: object must come after particle
points.rule_ru: Неразделяемые: дополнение должно идти после частицы
points.example: I ran into my friend. (NOT: I ran my friend into)

points.rule: Pronouns always go between (separable): verb + pronoun + particle
points.rule_ru: Местоимения всегда идут между (разделяемые): глагол + местоимение + частица
points.example: Pick it up. (NOT: Pick up it)

tasks.text: My weekend was busy! On Saturday, I got up late and put on some old clothes. I had to clean up my apartment because my parents were coming over. I threw away old magazines and picked up clothes from the floor. I called up my friend to help me. Together, we figured out how to fix my broken shelf. My parents showed up at 5 PM. We sat down for dinner. We talked about our plans and I brought up my idea to travel. They agreed to think it over. Sunday, I slept in and took it easy!

notice.reflection_question: Why can we say 'Turn off the TV' and 'Turn the TV off' but only 'Turn it off'?
notice.reflection_question_ru: Почему можно сказать 'Turn off the TV' и 'Turn the TV off', но только 'Turn it off'?

exercises.instruction: Match the phrasal verb with its meaning.
Complete with the correct phrasal verb.

sentences.sentence: Please ___ the lights when you leave. (extinguish)
I need to ___ what time the train leaves. (discover)
Can you ___ my cat while I'm away? (care for)
The plane ___ at 6 AM. (left the ground)
I ___ an old friend at the mall. (met unexpectedly)
My car ___ on the highway. (stopped working)
We need to ___ this problem quickly. (solve)

sentences.original: I threw away the old newspapers.

produce.instruction: Write about your daily routine or a recent experience using phrasal verbs.
produce.instruction_ru: Напиши о своём распорядке дня или недавнем опыте, используя фразовые глаголы.
prompts: Write about preparing for a trip
Write about meeting up with friends
produce.example: Yesterday was a crazy day! I woke up late because my alarm didn't go off. I jumped out of bed and quickly put on my clothes. I couldn't find my keys - I looked for them everywhere! Finally, I figured out they were in my coat pocket. I rushed out and ran into my boss on the way. We chatted briefly and then I hurried up to the meeting. Luckily, it hadn't started yet! After work, I met up with friends. We talked about our plans and decided to set up a weekend trip. It turned out to be a great day after all!
criteria: Uses at least 8 different phrasal verbs
Places pronouns correctly (between verb and particle)

input_flood.description: Read 5 texts rich in phrasal verbs.

texts.title: Morning Routine
texts.content: I wake up at 6:30 and get up immediately. I turn on the radio and listen while I get ready. I put on comfortable clothes and go downstairs. I switch on the coffee machine and wait for it to heat up. I usually look through the news on my phone. After breakfast, I clean up the kitchen. Then I put on my work clothes and head out. If I run into neighbors, I always say hello!

texts.title: Work Problems
texts.content: Yesterday, my computer broke down! I tried to figure out the problem but couldn't. I called up IT support and they came over quickly. They looked into the issue and found out it was a virus. They had to back up all my files first. Then they set up a new system. I had to catch up on all my work later. I wanted to give up, but I carried on until I finished everything.

texts.title: Travel Story
texts.content: Last month, I set off on a trip to Spain. The plane took off on time. When we landed, I picked up my luggage and checked into the hotel. I wanted to look around the city immediately! I put on comfortable shoes and went out. I ran into some other tourists and we hung out together. We looked for a good restaurant and ended up at a local tapas bar. It turned out to be amazing!

texts.title: New Apartment
texts.content: Moving into a new apartment is hard work! First, I had to clear out my old place. I threw away lots of old stuff. My friends came over to help out. We packed up all my things and loaded them into a truck. At the new place, we carried everything in. I set up my furniture and put away my clothes. By evening, I was worn out! But I was happy to finally settle in.

texts.title: Learning English
texts.content: When I started learning English, I almost gave up many times. But I carried on because I wanted to improve. I signed up for online classes. I wrote down new vocabulary every day. When I came across words I didn't know, I looked them up in the dictionary. I tried to speak up in class, even when nervous. I kept up with my homework. Now my English has really picked up! Don't give up - keep going!
